Type.Name: TargetInvocationException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable TargetInvocationException extends System.ApplicationException
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit TargetInvocationException extends System.ApplicationException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

remarks.para: TargetInvocationException uses the HRESULT COR_E_TARGETINVOCATION which has the value 0x80131604.
When created, the TargetInvocationException is passed a reference to the exception thrown by the method invoked through reflection. The property holds the underlying exception.

summary.para: The exception that is thrown by methods invoked through reflection. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(class System.Exception inner)
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Exception inner) cil managed

remarks.para: An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the property. The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or null if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of .

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

Docs.param: The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner)
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner) cil managed

remarks.para: An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the property. The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or null if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of .

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
